title: Behavioral acceptance of automated vehicles: The roles of perceived safety concern and current travel behavior. (arXiv:2302.12225v3 [econ.GN] UPDATED)
abstract: With the prospect of next-generation automated mobility ecosystem, the realization of the contended traffic efficiency and safety benefits are contingent upon the demand landscape for automated vehicles (AVs). Focusing on the public acceptance behavior of AVs, this empirical study addresses two gaps in the plethora of travel behavior research on identifying the potential determinants thereof. First, a clear behavioral understanding is lacking as to the perceived concern about AV safety and the consequent effect on AV acceptance behavior. Second, how people appraise the benefits of enhanced automated mobility to meet their current (pre-AV era) travel behavior and needs, along with the resulting impacts on AV acceptance and perceived safety concern, remain equivocal. To fill these gaps, a recursive trivariate econometric model with ordinal-continuous outcomes is employed, which jointly estimates AV acceptance (ordinal), perceived AV safety concern (ordinal), and current annual vehicle-mi

translated_title: 自动驾驶车辆的行为接受度：感知安全关切和当前出行行为的作用
translated_abstract: 随着下一代自动化移动生态系统的前景，实现争议中的交通效率和安全效益取决于对自动驾驶车辆（AVs）的需求情景。本实证研究聚焦于AVs的公众接受行为，解决了旅行行为研究领域存在的两个差距。首先，缺乏对于AV安全关切的行为理解以及其对AV接受行为的影响。其次，人们如何评估提升的自动化移动性能够满足他们当前（AV时代之前）的出行行为和需求，并且对AV接受度和感知安全关切产生的影响尚不明确。为了填补这些差距，我们使用了递归三变量计量模型，该模型共同估计AV接受度（有序），感知AV安全关切（有序）和当前年度车辆行程（连续）。
tldr: 本研究通过递归三变量计量模型，揭示了自动驾驶车辆的行为接受度受到人们对安全关切的认知和当前出行行为的影响。
